awd_titl_txt: Evaluation of Seismic Base Isolation Systems
awd_abstract_narration: Base isolation systems offer an attractive method to mitigate the               effects of earthquake loadings on structures.  By partially decoupling          the structure from the earthquake ground motion, the inertial forces            within the structure can be reduced, thus significantly decreasing the          potential for damage to the structure.  The base isolation concept is           receiving considerable attention throughout the world as a design               strategy.  This research project will develop guidelines that will help         the practicing engineer to decide whether the base isolation system             strategy is appropriate for a particular structure.  The project will           develop a comprehensive state-of-the-art summary, determine the dynamic         response characteristics of various base isolation systems, and develop         guidelines for the use of base isolation systems.  This information             will then be systematically catalogued for use by engineers.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
